Have you solved this yet?

If not, try ALSO adding the classes you want to test to the CLASSPATH;
like so:
 CLASSPATH=.;c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar

(Notice the dot ('.') at the beginning of the classpath setting.  (You
may have to change that to classes, or wherever the classes that you
want to test are located.)

This has already been suggested to you by J.B. (and possibly others),
just not explicitly.  As J.B. says, I would also recommend that you use
the -classpath option provided by the JVM, instead of using the
CLASSPATH env variable.

> > I am receiving a message called "Class not found" after running
> the 
> > following command:
> > 
> > c:\>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> > 
> > I also made sure that my CLASSPATH is set properly as: 
> > CLASSPATH=c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
> > 
> > whereas my "junit.jar" file is installed into the following
> directory:
> > 
> > c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
> > 

Manuel Amago.
